Stopped by here last week for a date and this place gets 5/5 simply because the date went super well (haha just kidding - kinda).

The restaurant was pretty empty so it was nice and the environment was really welcoming. The staff were all really friendly and really nice. The food came out fast and it was delicious! We both ordered the BRGR and had no complaints. It was the perfect serving size and we got a basket of fries to share.

My date actually broke his water glass (HAHA) but the the staff hurriedly came out and cleaned it up and were very nice about it. We both appreciated that a lot. Look forward to coming here again!

I come here quite often and have always had great experiences. Service is good, the food is good, and the shakes are AMAZING (my favorite is The Dude which is not on the menu). I always fall into a severe food coma immediately following the meal, and need a good nap if I plan to do anything remotely productive at any point during the rest of the day. Despite that, I keep coming back!

Walked into BRGR early Saturday afternoon, and they had about 15 patrons seated and situated. Once we were seated, without waters, drink orders, etc., we sat idle for about 25 minutes (while staff walked past us 6 times). We then decided that this was completely unreasonable (seeing that several staff members were standing around) and decided to leave and walk to Urban Tap right up the street, where we were taken care of in less than 5 minutes. Cheers!

Brgr has imaginative tasty burgers.  BUT, for a $13 burger I expect more.  The portions are small.  The food is greasy.  The prices create an expectation of a higher end experience.  The food is tasty, but they really need to take the atmosphere and dishes to a higher level to justify their prices.  If I want a gourmet burger, I'd choose Burgatory at the waterworks instead.

Very slow service.  Messed up our orders.  The appetizer came out wrong (fires instead of homemade chips and my burger wasn't supposed to have cheese on it.  Probably a good mistake as the chips were pretty bad.   Not my favorite burger joint.  I would much rather hit Ray's Hellburger in DC for a good burger!  The Green Man shake was the best part of the meal!

We decided to give BRGR another shot, add I had only been there right after they opened and was underwhelmed. 
Today, around 130 on a Saturday, it was surprisingly not very busy. We were seated right away at the table of our choosing. Waitress came up to us very quickly, and was smiling and sincere. We ordered drinks and fries to start, and they came very quickly. The fries! So fresh, with a perfect amount of parm and herbs. I got a sly fox pils, it was very refreshing.
My mahi mahi (Maui wowie on menu) burger was obviously freshly made, not a frozen pattie. I had it on the lettuce wrap, which actually worked well! My friend had the shroom burger, and she said it was great... It must have been because she never finishes anything and there was only a bit left! 
All in all, extremely pleased with the great lunch, atmosphere and service.

We have always wanted to try this place , so today while at the Galleria we decided to have lunch , sad to say we still have not sampled their food , we were seated promptly- but sit there for 15 minutes waiting as waitress after waitress passed us by , we ask the hostess and said yes give us a minute another 5 and we left would be different if they were busy but in this case not.

Worst experience ever!!! Service was awful and the manger was even worse. I would never go back here. We ordered an appetizer when we ordered our drinks. After we ordered our food our waitress never came back. We had to call her over to our table multiple times. She never refreshed our drinks. After 25 minutes of waiting for our app, we had to reminder her that we wanted our appetizer before our meal. She stated "ohhhh yeah I forgot". She brought the app out and 2 minutes later brought out our burgers. We order 1 medium burger and 2 medium well. The two that order medium well were still dripping blood! The medium was the most cooked burger. When we called our waitress over to ask to have new burger (yes -- she never return to check on us after delivering our food-- we had to wait another 15 minutes) she gave us an education on how that is how BRGR does their burgers. She said that their cooks are the worst ever. After taking our plates back to the kitchen she returned to tell us that they were "heating them up on the microwave". SERIOUSLY???????!!!!!! 

When we asked to talk to the manager she came over and asked what we wanted her to do about it. We said we wanted new burgers and she said she would see what she could do. When she returned we told her that we didn't want the food anymore and we were leaving. She told us that we would have to pay for the check! When we questioned it she said "well you have to pay for the beers". I was fine with paying for the two beers we got. When she brought over the check it was $40. When we questioned it, she insisted we pay and ran back into the kitchen. We went up to the hostess booth and asked to speak to the manager again. She came out and threaten to call the police if we didn't pay. FOR FOOD WE DIDNT EAT!!!

We live 5 minutes from the Galleria and we will never be returning. Especially since their own staff says their cooks are the worst! No thank you! Beware and save your money! Wish you could give a zero star on yelp!
